cluster_classes.class_description: Anatomical defensive structures on caterpillars, such as spines and hairs, that provide physical protection against predators and other threats.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Some caterpillars have spines or hairs for protection... protective adaptations.

members.entity_description: Defensive protrusions on some caterpillars used as protection against threats.
Hair-like structures on some caterpillars providing physical protection.
Combined defensive structures on caterpillars used to protect them from threats.

remarks: Placed in broader anatomical Class_Group so it can be related systematically to other caterpillar anatomical structures (including integument) while the class name/description preserve its defensive function.

cluster_classes.class_description: The external anatomical covering of caterpillars, including the skin and associated surface structures that are shed and replaced during growth and molting.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The external anatomical covering of caterpillars that is repeatedly shed and replaced during growth.

members.entity_description: The external anatomical covering of caterpillars that is repeatedly shed and replaced during growth.

remarks: Class represents the general external covering (integument); grouping under the same anatomical Class_Group as defensive external structures supports a coherent anatomical schema.

args.remark: Placed in broader anatomical Class_Group so it can be related systematically to other caterpillar anatomical structures (including integument) while the class name/description preserve its defensive function.
args.justification: Defensive spines and hairs are specific external anatomical structures of caterpillars; aligning the class_group to the broader anatomical domain ('Caterpillar Anatomy') better connects it with other anatomical classes like integument while keeping the class itself functionally focused on defense.

args.remark: Class represents the general external covering (integument); grouping under the same anatomical Class_Group as defensive external structures supports a coherent anatomical schema.
args.justification: The integument (skin) is the fundamental external anatomical covering of caterpillars; using the same broader Class_Group ('Caterpillar Anatomy') as other external structures like defensive spines/hairs provides a consistent upper-level anatomical grouping while keeping this class narrowly scoped to skin.

executed_decisions.remark: Placed in broader anatomical Class_Group so it can be related systematically to other caterpillar anatomical structures (including integument) while the class name/description preserve its defensive function.
executed_decisions.justification: Defensive spines and hairs are specific external anatomical structures of caterpillars; aligning the class_group to the broader anatomical domain ('Caterpillar Anatomy') better connects it with other anatomical classes like integument while keeping the class itself functionally focused on defense.

executed_decisions.remark: Class represents the general external covering (integument); grouping under the same anatomical Class_Group as defensive external structures supports a coherent anatomical schema.
executed_decisions.justification: The integument (skin) is the fundamental external anatomical covering of caterpillars; using the same broader Class_Group ('Caterpillar Anatomy') as other external structures like defensive spines/hairs provides a consistent upper-level anatomical grouping while keeping this class narrowly scoped to skin.
